data.title: Y?
data.text: Ynot....? Yeah, there is no reason why to give this place any business. Poor service and poorer attitudes.

data.title: Fun place!
data.text: Came in on a very busy night before a concert, the staff was very friendly and working hard to get everyone served.  Food and drink was all very good, I would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Good Spot for Food
data.text: I like this place for good food and  a nice atmosphere.  Not too rowdy but very pleasant place to be...

data.title: Convenient location. Average sports bar
data.text:
I went to this bar after a concert at the Xfinity arena with some friends. Location is prime for that, and it's a good place to kill time while the traffic clears out.

The place was decked out for Halloween. The bar feels cozy, neighborhoody. 

Our server was quite nice and patient with our group, who sent her back for something else every time she stopped by the table. I do think the place was understaffed for a concert night. Poor thing was running her tail off.

My greatest hang up on this place was the food. It was so mediocre. I didn't sample my friends food, but they were disappointed with their quesadilla and nachos. I got a fajita wrap, and it was a cold chicken salad comprised mostly of olive and red onion with a lot of mayo, which just wasn't what the description let on. Nothing heinous, no hair in our food. Just meh food for $10 a plate. 

I would go again for drinks!

data.title: Great Burgers and Cold Beer!!
data.text: Great Burgers and Cold Beer - it doesn't get any better. Our golf foursome stopped in for dinner in late June 2015. The place was packed but the service was still awesome and fast. We all ordered burgers and they were big and delicious!!   Lots of choice for beers. Will stop again if we are in the area!!

data.title: Liked it so much we went back later
data.text: Dropped in here for a bite to eat and a beer before the hockey game across the street. Food good, staff were friendly and attentive.  Decent beer selections.  It was good enough that we went back for more after the game !

data.title: Needs some work
data.text:
We had a coupon so tried the Ynot on a Friday at happy hour.  Probably four tables had people, couple of people at the bar, but no happy hour crowd.  First impression, it smells like a dive bar, and I don't mean just beer.  I almost couldn't get past that, but persevered because of the coupon. Decor is consistent with the Pub and Grub name. Music was so loud it was very difficult to carry on a conversation, which we mentioned without any change in the sound level.  

The bartender/waitress was wonderful.  Very attentive, great customer service. Very generous alcohol pours.

Food depended on what we ordered.  Chicken strips rated excellent.  Burger was burnt and dry. Salad was fresh.

I have a second coupon.  We will return for the great customer service and order the chicken strips, or try the fish strips.  But there are issues that need to be addressed.

data.title: Small place big taste
data.text: May look like a hole in the wall dive but when you come in the people are friendly and the food is worth the wait. When it's a game day it will get real busy real fast as it caters to those with kids. Definite place to come back to when in the area.

data.title: Fancier than most pubs
data.text: Great selection of food, decent prices, friendly help.  Food tasted great and portion was good also.  All in all a nice friendly pub with grub

data.title: Big, no, HUGE surprise!
data.text: Great service, great atmosphere, great service, great food and...did i mention really great service? I had the Husky Dawg, described in the menu as "a big dog served on a pretzel bun, smothered in cheese, chili, bacon bits and jalapenos". I've had terrible dogs, mediocre dogs, good dogs but this...this was a huge beautiful plump juicy all beef hot dog with grill marks, smothered with house made chili that was so good and it was obviously cooked long and slow, nacho cheese and real cooked bacon crumbles, not dry crusty salad topping, jalapenos AND A PRETZEL BUN?! I know it sounds ridiculous to be gushing over a hot dog but i'd come here and have this dog weekly if i lived nearby. My companion had the hearty half order of nachos, which looked pretty typical but he said the were good. Nice drink selection at the bar and ample TVs for sports viewing. Best of all the barkeep was casual but friendly. We felt like regulars. She chatted, joked, served us and refilled our glasses right on schedule, when the glasses were low but not empty. Definitely will return and recommend!
